items: 1 and a half Tbsp Cold Butter

vocab.def: To mix butter into flour using fingertips until it feels like sand.
To scatter small pieces or powder over food.

steps.title: Dice the Apple
steps.desc: Wash your apple. Use the plastic knife to dice the apple into small cubes. Do not peel the skin (it has vitamins!).
steps.note: Action: Put cubes in the foil cup. Sprinkle with cinnamon.

steps.title: The Dry Mix
steps.desc: In your mixing bowl, combine the Flour, Sugar, and Oats.

steps.title: The Rub-In Technique
steps.desc: Add the Cold Butter. Use your fingertips to rub the butter into the flour mix.
steps.note: Pro Tip: Keep the butter cold! If it melts, your crumble won't be crunchy. Stop when it looks like wet sand.

steps.title: Assemble & Deploy
steps.desc: Layer the apples on the bottom of the cup and sprinkle a layer of sugar and cinnamon. Pour your "sand" mixture over the apples in the cup. Make sure the apples are covered.
steps.note: Final Step: Hand it to the teacher. We bake for 25-30 minutes at 180°C.
